title: Biblical Food Laws Commandments Quiz - Biblical Commands About Biblical Food Laws
description: Test your knowledge of the 35 biblical commandments related to biblical food laws. Covers 9 positive and 26 negative commandments from the Torah.

questions.question: Which positive commandment directs to examine signs of animals to distinguish kosher from non-kosher?
options: Examine the signs of animals to distinguish kosher and non-kosher
Do not eat meat and milk cooked together
questions.correctAnswer: Examine the signs of animals to distinguish kosher and non-kosher
questions.explanation: Commandment #176 instructs to examine the signs of animals to distinguish kosher animals, found in Leviticus 11:2.

questions.question: According to the commandments, which birds are explicitly forbidden to be eaten?
questions.correctAnswer: Eagle, vulture, buzzard
questions.explanation: Commandment #181 lists certain birds like eagle, vulture, and buzzard as non-kosher and forbidden, from Leviticus 11:13.

questions.question: What is the positive commandment related to fish in the food category?
options: Examine the signs of fish to distinguish kosher and non-kosher
Do not eat meat and milk cooked together
questions.correctAnswer: Examine the signs of fish to distinguish kosher and non-kosher
questions.explanation: Commandment #178 is a positive mitzvah to examine fish signs to know which are kosher, as found in Leviticus 11:9.

questions.question: Which commandment forbids eating the sinew of the thigh?
options: Do not eat the sinew of the thigh
Do not eat meat and milk cooked together
Do not eat of an animal that dies of natural causes
questions.correctAnswer: Do not eat the sinew of the thigh
questions.explanation: Commandment #194 prohibits eating the sinew of the thigh, based on Genesis 32:32.

questions.question: Which verse commands not to eat meat torn off a living creature?
questions.correctAnswer: Deuteronomy 12:23
questions.explanation: Commandment #191 forbids eating meat torn off a living creature in Deuteronomy 12:23.

questions.question: True or False: Commandment #195 forbids eating meat and milk cooked together.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Commandment #195 explicitly forbids eating meat and milk cooked together, based on Exodus 23:19.

questions.question: Which commandment requires covering the blood of a slaughtered beast or fowl with earth?
options: Cover the blood of a slaughtered beast or fowl with earth
Do not eat meat and milk cooked together
questions.correctAnswer: Cover the blood of a slaughtered beast or fowl with earth
questions.explanation: Commandment #206 instructs covering blood with earth after slaughter, found in Leviticus 17:13.

questions.question: What does commandment #189 prohibit regarding an ox that has gored someone to death?
options: Do not benefit from it or eat its flesh
Slaughter it and eat its meat
questions.correctAnswer: Do not benefit from it or eat its flesh
questions.explanation: Commandment #189 forbids benefiting from or eating the flesh of an ox condemned to be stoned, per Exodus 21:28.

questions.question: True or False: Commandment #188 permits eating an animal that died naturally.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Commandment #188 prohibits eating an animal that dies of itself, according to Deuteronomy 14:21.

questions.question: Which commandment forbids eating blood and certain fats of clean animals?
options: Do not eat any fat or any blood
Do not eat meat and milk cooked together
Do not eat worms found in fruit
questions.correctAnswer: Do not eat any fat or any blood
questions.explanation: Commandments #192 and #193 prohibit eating blood and certain fats, from Leviticus 3:17.

questions.question: True or False: The commandment to release the mother bird before taking her children is positive.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Commandment #208 is a positive mitzvah to release the mother bird before taking her young, as in Deuteronomy 22:7.

questions.question: Which of these commandments forbids eating fruit from a tree during its first three years?
options: Do not eat fruit of a tree during its first three years
Do not eat ripened grains from new grain before the Omer
Do not eat parched grains from new grain before the Omer
questions.correctAnswer: Do not eat fruit of a tree during its first three years
questions.explanation: Commandment #200 forbids eating fruit from a tree during its first three years, based on Leviticus 19:23.

questions.question: What is forbidden by commandment #205?
options: Slaughtering an animal and its offspring on the same day
Eating meat and milk cooked together
questions.correctAnswer: Slaughtering an animal and its offspring on the same day
questions.explanation: Commandment #205 forbids slaughtering an animal and its young on the same day, from Leviticus 22:28.

questions.question: Which commandment instructs to ritually slaughter an animal before eating it?
options: Ritually slaughter an animal before eating it
Do not eat worms found in fruit
Do not eat meat torn off a living creature
questions.correctAnswer: Ritually slaughter an animal before eating it
questions.explanation: Commandment #204 is a positive mitzvah to ritually slaughter animals before consumption, from Deuteronomy 12:21.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "You shall not boil a young goat in its ______ mother's milk."
questions.correctAnswer: mother's
questions.explanation: Commandments #195 and #196 forbid cooking or eating meat in its mother's milk, as stated in Exodus 23:19 and 34:26.

questions.question: Which commandment forbids eating worms found in fruit on the ground?
options: Do not eat worms found in fruit on the ground
Do not eat diverse seeds planted in a vineyard
Do not eat meat and milk cooked together
questions.correctAnswer: Do not eat worms found in fruit on the ground
questions.explanation: Commandment #186 forbids eating worms found in fruit on the ground, from Leviticus 11:42.

questions.question: True or False: One positive commandment in the food category is to set aside the first fruits and bring them to the Temple.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Commandment #270 commands setting aside and bringing the first fruits to the Temple, from Exodus 23:19.

questions.question: What does commandment #207 prohibit in relation to bird nests?
options: Do not take a mother bird with its children
Do not eat worms in fruit
Do not eat meat and milk cooked together
questions.correctAnswer: Do not take a mother bird with its children
questions.explanation: Commandment #207 forbids taking a mother bird along with her children from the nest, per Deuteronomy 22:6.

questions.question: Which commandment forbids planting grains or greens in a vineyard?
options: Do not plant grains or greens in a vineyard
Do not eat worms found in fruit on the ground
Do not eat meat torn off a living creature
questions.correctAnswer: Do not plant grains or greens in a vineyard
questions.explanation: Commandment #235 forbids planting grains or greens in a vineyard, from Deuteronomy 22:9.

questions.question: True or False: Commandment #183 forbids eating all flying insects.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Commandment #183 forbids eating non-kosher flying insects, per Deuteronomy 14:19.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "You shall not eat anything which dies of _________."
questions.correctAnswer: itself
questions.explanation: Commandment #188 forbids eating animals that die of themselves, from Deuteronomy 14:21.

questions.question: Which positive commandment instructs to examine signs of insects to know which are kosher?
options: Examine the signs of insects to distinguish kosher and non-kosher
Do not eat non-kosher creatures that crawl on land
Do not eat meat and milk cooked together
questions.correctAnswer: Examine the signs of insects to distinguish kosher and non-kosher
questions.explanation: Commandment #179 requires examining certain insects to determine kosher status, found in Leviticus 11:21.

questions.question: According to the commandments, what must be done with the flesh of an animal that was mortally wounded?
options: It must not be eaten and should be thrown to the dogs
It may be eaten after ritual slaughter
It must be cooked with milk
It should be sold to foreigners
questions.correctAnswer: It must not be eaten and should be thrown to the dogs
questions.explanation: Commandment #190 forbids eating flesh torn to pieces in the field and commands to throw it to the dogs, from Exodus 22:31.

questions.question: What positive commandment involves distinguishing kosher fowl?
options: Examine the signs of fowl to distinguish kosher and non-kosher
Do not eat meat and milk cooked together
questions.correctAnswer: Examine the signs of fowl to distinguish kosher and non-kosher
questions.explanation: Commandment #177 instructs to examine signs of kosher fowl, from Deuteronomy 14:11.

questions.question: True or False: Commandment #182 forbids eating non-kosher fish.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Commandment #182 forbids eating non-kosher fish, as stated in Leviticus 11:11.
